page.title: 11EDUCATION IN HAMBLEDON
page.content:
{ HAMBLEDON COUNTY FIRST SCHOOL
Hambledon County First School was founded as a National School in 1849.It still has its Headmaster's house with the date above the door.The school has been modernised and well equipped and now has an assembly hall and a kitchen. The present age range of children is 5-8 years. There is a private nursery school which meets in the building by arrangement with the Education Authority. Children over the age of 8 years are taken by bus to Denmead Middle School. Those over the age of 12 years attend the comprehensive schools at Crookhorn and Cowplain.
